    • Method Detail

      • setEnablingTime

        public void setEnablingTime(long time)
        Sets the enabling time. This is intended to be used when the associated transition is enabled
        Parameters:
        time - timestamp in miliseconds when the enabling occurs

      • getEnablingTime

        public long getEnablingTime()
        Returns:
        the enabling time

      • inTimeSpan

        public boolean inTimeSpan(long time)
        Parameters:
        time - timestamp in miliseconds to figure out whether it's inside the span
        Returns:
        true if time is inside the span

      • isBeforeTimeSpan

        public boolean isBeforeTimeSpan(long time)
        Parameters:
        time - timestamp in miliseconds to figure out whether it's before the span
        Returns:
        true if time is befire the span

      • setTimeSpan

        public void setTimeSpan(int timeB,
                        int timeE)
        Set the begining and ending increments to add to the enabling time in order to set the span
        Parameters:
        timeB - set time in miliseconds used to generate the span begin time
        timeE - set time in miliseconds used to generate the span end time
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
